clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of ACH24 in the Treatment of Vitiligo
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Parallel Group Study of the Efficacy and Safety of ACH24 in the Treatment of Vitiligo

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter clinical trial, phase III, randomized, placebo-controlled, parallel group, enroll 94 patients, to assess the efficacy of ACH24 in the repigmentation of achromatic areas in patients with vitiligo.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of ACH24 compared to placebo in the treatment of vitiligo.The present study aims to register a new product in the country, the ACH24 for the treatment of vitiligo.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The Brazilian regulatory agency - ANVISA has requested the cancellation of the phase 3 study for conducting a phase 1 study first.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Repigmentation of the affected area assessed by VASI (vitiligo area scoring index).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to the end of 18 months of treatment
primary_outcome.description: It is considered successful treatment a repigmentation of greater than or equal to 50% of the affected area assessed by VASI (vitiligo area scoring index).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and each 12 weeks of treatment (V0, V3, V6, V9, V12, V15, V18)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety descriptive about occurence of adverse events, evaluation of results of general physical examination.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Will be evaluated during whole study, at the baseline and after 18 months of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Collection of safety data throughout the whole study period
